content.description:
Climb a cool hand crack with good hands.

Descend with an easy walkoff.
content.location: Right where powerline trail joins Ginny Trail, look west, and you will see the boulder with the crack in it.

content.description: Start at the obvious crack on the bottom using face features. Move straight up, and work slightly left to grab a hold of the arete. Make one big move to grab a hold of the jug on top.
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter would be good.
content.location:
There are three distinct boulders to the south of

Powerline Crack

. This is on the first tall boulder that looks like a squirrel on the face.

content.description: A small dihedral leads up to roof with a crack above it that requires a hand jam above the roof to pull over it. This has fun movement.
content.protection: It is easy to set up a toprope or it would protect well with hand-sized cams.
content.location: Right when you arrive at the beginning of the meadow, head north up an drainage toward obvious rock formations. There is an obvious looking Chimpmunk Rock. The climb is right behind it.
